Name: Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney
Description: The first Phoenix Wright game

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 1-1
Description: Episode 1: The First Turnabout is the first episode of the game Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney. In Phoenix Wright's first trial as a defense attorney he must defend his childhood friend Larry Butz, who has been accused of murdering his ex-girlfriend Cindy Stone.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 1-2
Description: Episode 2: Turnabout Sisters is the second case in Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney. With his mentor Mia Fey murdered, it is up to Phoenix Wright to clear the name of the prime suspect: Mia's little sister Maya. However, in order to do this, Wright must defeat the undefeated "Demon Attorney", Miles Edgeworth.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 1-3
Description: Episode 3: Turnabout Samurai is the third episode of Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney. It revolves around a murder that occurs during a production of the fictional television show The Steel Samurai: Warrior of Neo Olde Tokyo.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 1-4
Description: Episode 4: Turnabout Goodbyes is the fourth episode of Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney. In this episode, Phoenix's rival in the courtroom, Miles Edgeworth, is arrested for the murder of a former defense attorney. Phoenix takes to his defense, and the veteran prosecutor opposing him is Manfred von Karma, Edgeworth's mentor. In resolving the case, Phoenix reveals a connection to the unsolved DL-6 Incident from fifteen years prior - a case that greatly impacted Miles due to the victim's identity.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 1-5
Description: Episode 5: Rise from the Ashes is the final episode of Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney. Set two months after Turnabout Goodbyes, Phoenix Wright is brought out of a self-imposed break to investigate a case involving a friend of his mentor from law school, who has already confessed to murder.

Name: Phoenix Wright: Justice for All
Description: The second Phoenix Wright game

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 2-1
Description: Episode 1: The Lost Turnabout is the introductory and tutorial episode of Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Justice For All. In this episode, an amnesiac Phoenix Wright must defend unlucky police officer Maggey Byrde, accused of murdering her lover and fellow policeman, Dustin Prince, while dealing with a highly egotistical witness.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 2-2
Description: Reunion, and Turnabout*: Maya Fey is once again accused of murder, with the victim this time being a doctor who was with her in a sealed room in her home village while attempting to channel a former colleague of his. Wright again defends her, only to face Franziska von Karma, the whip-wielding daughter of Manfred von Karma, at the prosecutor's bench. While investigating Kurain Village, Wright learns more about the family of his assistant and meets Maya's little cousin Pearl Fey for the first time.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 2-3
Description: Turnabout Big Top: Wright defends Max Galactica, a flamboyant magician accused of murdering the ringmaster of the circus where he works.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 2-4
Description: Farewell, My Turnabout: As a television star is found murdered, Wright discovers that Maya has been kidnapped. The defense attorney finds his morality tested as an anonymous caller demands that he get the prime suspect a complete acquittal, or else...

Name: Phoenix Wright: Trials and Tribulations
Description: The third Phoenix Wright game

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 3-1
Description: Episode 1: Turnabout Memories is the first episode of the video game Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Trials and Tribulations. The player assumes the role of Mia Fey in her second court trial, set to defend Phoenix Wright, an art student in Ivy University, from the charge of murdering Doug Swallow. Dahlia Hawthorne debuts in this case.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 3-2
Description: Episode 2: The Stolen Turnabout is the second episode in the video game Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Trials and Tribulations. Phoenix Wright must defend Ron DeLite as he is charged with the theft of the Sacred Urn of Kurain Village and, later, the murder of Kane Bullard. Prosecutor Godot debuts in this episode.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 3-3
Description: Episode 3: Recipe for Turnabout is the third episode in Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Trials and Tribulations.One month ago, former policewoman Maggey Byrde once again found herself on trial for a murder she did not commit. Accused of killing a computer programmer, Maggey was convicted after receiving a shoddy defense from an impostor posing as Phoenix Wright. Now, the real Phoenix demands a retrial for this case, and pieces together the truth behind this murder.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 3-4
Description: Episode 4: Turnabout Beginnings is the fourth episode in Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Trials and Tribulations. This episode marks the courtroom debuts of defense attorney Mia Fey and prosecutor Miles Edgeworth. This episode takes place one year prior to Mia's second trial, which was shown in the game's first episode. In this episode, a death row inmate and prison escapee is suspected of murdering the policewoman whose testimony put him on death row five years prior on a bridge, and it is up to Mia to defend him. Mia is assisted by a coffee loving man who is strikingly familiar to the enigmatic prosecutor of the game's previous two episodes.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 3-5
Description: Episode 5: Bridge to the Turnabout is the final episode in Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Trials and Tribulations and the final case in the original Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney Trilogy. This episode acts as a final reunion of the main characters throughout the trilogy, as well as bringing closure to the overall story arc of the game itself.

Name: Apollo Justice: Ace Attorney
Description: The fourth game in the ace attorney series

Name: Apollo Justice Case 4-1
Description: Episode 1: Turnabout Trump is the first episode in the game Apollo Justice: Ace Attorney and follows the first trial of the protagonist, Apollo Justice, as a defense attorney. Justice's first case is the defense of the legendary former defense attorney Phoenix Wright, who has been accused of murdering his opponent in a poker game.

Name: Apollo Justice Case 4-2
Description: Episode 2: Turnabout Corner is the second case in Apollo Justice: Ace Attorney. Two months after losing his job at Gavin Law Offices as a result of his first trial, Apollo Justice visits Phoenix Wright's old office and is immediately pulled into investigating three separate incidents that happened the previous night. With Phoenix's daughter Trucy helping him out, Justice learns that these seemingly unrelated events are actually connected to a fourth, more serious incident: a murder allegedly committed by the son of local crime lords Winfred and Plum Kitaki. In taking the case, Justice discovers more about the strange power of his bracelet and is introduced to his ex-mentor's brother, Klavier Gavin, who goes up against him on the prosecutor's bench. This episode also reintroduces Detective Ema Skye, whose once-cheerful demeanor has largely given way to cynicism and disappointment at failing to achieve her dreams.

Name: Apollo Justice Case 4-3
Description: Episode 3: Turnabout Serenade is the third episode in the video game Apollo Justice: Ace Attorney. The Borginian duo Lamiroir and Machi Tobaye are invited by the Gavinners to guest perform in their "Guilty as Charged" Tour. However, the concert comes to a shocking conclusion when Lamiroir's manager, Romein LeTouse, is murdered in a series of events that seem to mimic the lyrics to the song "The Guitar's Serenade".

Name: Apollo Justice Case 4-4
Description: Episode 4: Turnabout Succession is the fourth and final episode of Apollo Justice: Ace Attorney. In it, Phoenix Wright arranges a test trial for the so-called "Jurist System", in which the verdict is decided by the consensus of six jurors from the public, instead of being rendered by the judge. Although Wright promises a simple case involving a young woman being accused of poisoning her father, defense attorney Apollo Justice and prosecutor Klavier Gavin soon learn that it is, in fact, connected to Wright's infamous final trial from seven years ago, in which he was caught presenting forged evidence and disbarred.

Name: Phoenix Wright: Dual Destinies
Description: The fifth game in the ace attorney series

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 5-1
Description: Episode 1: Turnabout Countdown is the first episode of the game Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Dual Destinies. It follows the second trial of defense attorney Phoenix Wright since his disbarment. Wright must defend the schoolgirl Juniper Woods on the charge of planting a bomb that destroyed Courtroom No. 4, resulting in the death of Detective Candice Arme. The episode introduces Athena Cykes, Wright's new assistant, and also reintroduces Apollo Justice, who is also an assistant of Wright.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 5-2
Description: Episode 2: The Monstrous Turnabout is the second episode of Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Dual Destinies. Jinxie Tenma has invited Trucy Wright and Apollo Justice for a celebration at Nine-Tails Vale. The festivities are abruptly interrupted, however, when the alderman of Nine-Tails Vale is found dead with a spear through his chest, and Jinxie Tenma's father, Damian Tenma, is arrested as the main suspect.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 5-3
Description: Episode 3: Turnabout Academy is the third episode of the game Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Dual Destinies. When a murder occurs at the Themis Legal Academy matching the one depicted in a mock trial, Juniper Woods, who set up the mock trial, finds herself as the defendant in a real one. Woods's friend Athena Cykes takes up her case, with Apollo Justice as co-counsel, against the mysterious convict prosecutor Simon Blackquill.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 5-4
Description: Episode 4: The Cosmic Turnabout is the fourth episode of the game Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Dual Destinies. When Apollo Justice's friend Clay Terran is murdered at the Cosmos Space Center, he takes on the case with Solomon Starbuck as his client. However, a deeper plot begins to play out behind the scenes, involving a mysterious "phantom" that Simon Blackquill has been chasing for seven years. Tensions rise even further when Apollo Justice suddenly leaves the agency to investigate the case on his own, leaving Phoenix Wright to handle Starbuck's case.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 5-5
Description: Episode 5: Turnabout for Tomorrow is the fifth and final episode of Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Dual Destinies, and is a direct continuation of the events of the previous episode, The Cosmic Turnabout. Central to this episode is the UR-1 Incident that occurred seven years prior to the game, which resulted in the death of Athena Cykes's mother Metis Cykes, as well as the arrest and subsequent imprisonment of prosecutor Simon Blackquill. Phoenix Wright uncovers the truth behind the UR-1 Incident and the murder of Clay Terran, and confronts the phantom behind the scenes of it all.

Name: Phoenix Wright: Spirit of Justice
Description: The sixth game in the ace attorney series

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 6-1
Description: Episode 1: The Foreign Turnabout is the first episode of Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Spirit of Justice. Phoenix Wright heads to the Kingdom of Khura'in to check up on his old friend, Maya Fey. While sightseeing, his tour guide, Ahlbi Ur'gaid, is arrested on suspicion of stealing the precious Founder's Orb and murdering a guard named Paht Rohl.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 6-2
Description: Episode 2: The Magical Turnabout is the second episode of Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Spirit of Justice. When a fellow performer dies during a magic show at the Penrose Theater, Trucy Wright is put on trial for murder. With Phoenix Wright out of the country, it is up to Apollo Justice and Athena Cykes to clear Trucy's name and save the Wright Anything Agency.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 6-3
Description: Episode 3: The Rite of Turnabout is the third episode of Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Spirit of Justice. Phoenix Wright's second case in Khura'in sees him once again defending his long-time friend Maya Fey on murder charges after a priest is killed during the final rite of her training.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 6-4
Description: Episode 4: Turnabout Storyteller is the fourth episode of Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Spirit of Justice. Athena Cykes takes on the case of Bucky Whet, a soba shop worker and an acquaintance of Simon Blackquill, who is accused of murdering Taifu Toneido at a yose, a theatre for performing rakugo.

Name: Phoenix Wright Case 6-5
Description: Episode 5: Turnabout Revolution is the fifth and final episode of the main story of Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Spirit of Justice. It is a two-part finale that follows Apollo Justice as he fights to resolve two cases with even higher stakes than his previous trial. In the first case, a dispute over the artifact known as the Founder's Orb leads to him and Athena Cykes facing Phoenix Wright on opposite sides of an American courtroom in a civil trial. The second case takes place in Khura'in, where Dhurke Sahdmadhi, the leader of the Defiant Dragons, is caught and tried for the murder of Minister Inga Karkhuul Khura'in. As the fate of the Khura'inese revolution against the Defense Culpability Act hangs in the balance, Apollo Justice faces his greatest challenge as he confronts not only his past, but the ruling monarch of Khura'in herself.

Name: Ace Attorney Investigations 1
Description: Ace Attorney Investigations: Miles Edgeworth is the fifth game in the Ace Attorney series, taking place about a month after the third game.

Name: Ace Attorney Investigations Case 1-1
Description: Episode 1: Turnabout Visitor is the first episode of Ace Attorney Investigations: Miles Edgeworth. It concerns the murder of a detective in Miles Edgeworth's office. Although the first episode in the game, it is actually the fourth one chronologically.

Name: Ace Attorney Investigations Case 1-2
Description: Episode 2: Turnabout Airlines is the second episode of Ace Attorney Investigations: Miles Edgeworth. It involves a murder on an airplane, and Edgeworth must solve the case before he himself is incriminated. This is also the first case in the game chronologically other than the flashback case Turnabout Reminiscence.

Name: Ace Attorney Investigations Case 1-3
Description: Episode 3: The Kidnapped Turnabout is the third episode of Ace Attorney Investigations: Miles Edgeworth. In this episode, Ernest Amano sends Miles Edgeworth to drop off a ransom for his kidnapped son Lance Amano, and things go south from there. Chronologically, this episode takes place after the second episode, but before the first one.

Name: Ace Attorney Investigations Case 1-4
Description: This episode chronicles what was originally going to be the first trial of Miles Edgeworth, until the trial was canceled due to the murders of both the defendant and the prosecutor whom Edgeworth was set to replace. Edgeworth's mentor, Manfred von Karma, tasks both Miles and his teen daughter with investigating the double murder. This episode shows Edgeworth's first meetings with both Dick Gumshoe and Kay Faraday. What would later be Edgeworth's first trial was shown in Turnabout Beginnings.

Name: Ace Attorney Investigations Case 1-5
Description: Episode 5: Turnabout Ablaze is the fifth and final episode of Ace Attorney Investigations: Miles Edgeworth. It all starts when Kay Faraday is accused of murdering a man in a burnt-out embassy office. Cameos abound and two countries that were once one clash as Miles Edgeworth finally defeats the international smuggling ring and solves the mystery of the Great Thief Yatagarasu.

Name: Ace Attorney Investigations 2
Description: Gyakuten Kenji 2, also referred to as Ace Attorney Investigations 2 by Capcom staff, is the sequel to Gyakuten Kenji (known as Ace Attorney Investigations: Miles Edgeworth in English) and the sixth game in the Ace Attorney series of text adventure video games.

Name: Ace Attorney Investigations Case 2-1
Description: Episode 1: Turnabout Target is the first case in Gyakuten Kenji 2. It is set about two weeks after Turnabout Ablaze, the final case of the previous game. In this episode, Miles Edgeworth and Dick Gumshoe reunite with Kay Faraday while investigating an unsuccessful assassination attempt on the president of Zheng Fa at Gourd Lake. During the investigation, Edgeworth reunites with an old enemy of his, and later has to investigate the murder of the president's lead bodyguard.

Name: Ace Attorney Investigations Case 2-2
Description: Episode 2: The Imprisoned Turnabout is the second case of Gyakuten Kenji 2. The case takes place in a prison, and follows Miles Edgeworth as he crosses paths with judge Justine Courtney and prosecutor Sebastian Debeste for the first time, and reunites with an old friend of his father's, Raymond Shields.

Name: Ace Attorney Investigations Case 2-3
Description: Episode 3: The Inherited Turnabout is the third episode of Gyakuten Kenji 2. Raymond Shields takes Miles Edgeworth to a mansion once owned by Jeffrey Master and tells him about the IS-7 Incident. This incident is Gregory Edgeworth's final case, in which he attempts to clear Master of a murder charge while confronting the infamous Manfred von Karma. As the story is being told, someone attempts to murder one of the people involved in the IS-7 Incident, and Sebastian Debeste and Justine Courtney take over the ensuing investigation. In order to solve the case, Miles must connect the two incidents together, and finish what his father started.

Name: Ace Attorney Investigations Case 2-4
Description: Episode 4: The Forgotten Turnabout is the fourth and penultimate episode of Gyakuten Kenji 2. When Kay Faraday shows up in Miles Edgeworth's office with memory loss, the prosecutor heads to Grand Tower with her and Dick Gumshoe to investigate what happened to her. However, complications arise when a member of the Prosecutorial Investigation Committee turns up dead, and Faraday becomes the prime suspect. As the accusations pile on, Edgeworth makes a shocking decision and lays everything on the line to save Faraday and get to the truth behind the case.

Name: Ace Attorney Investigations Case 2-5
Description: Taking place immediately after the end of the previous episode, Miles Edgeworth and Kay Faraday find themselves investigating the murder of Zheng Fa President Di-Jun Huang, whom they had exposed the staged assassination attempt of only weeks prior. In addition to this, a child is kidnapped, and the duo go on a mission to find him before time runs out. This case brings a resolution to the overarching plot of the game. In this episode, Edgeworth determines which path he will follow, helps Sebastian Debeste confront his father, resolves a 12-year old murder case of key significance to the present-day case, and finally exposes and confronts the true mastermind behind all of the game's events.

Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: Phoenix Wright is a veteran defense attorney who heads the Wright Anything Agency. Mostly specializing in criminal trials
Tag 1: Wright is renowned for his ability to turn seemingly hopeless cases around.

Name: Mia Fey
Description: Mia Fey was a defense attorney known for her undying belief in her clients. She was Phoenix Wright's boss and mentor
Tag 1: and she left her firm to him after her death at the hands of Redd White.

Name: Larry Butz
Description: Larry Butz is Phoenix Wright's oldest friend and first client
Tag 1: and a childhood friend of Miles Edgeworth as well.

Name: Payne
Description: Winston Payne is a prosecutor often called the "Rookie Killer" due to his tendency to defeat novice defense attorneys. He is notable for being the first courtroom opponent of Phoenix Wright and Apollo Justice
Tag 1: as well as the second opponent of Mia Fey.

Name: Cindy Stone
Description: Cindy Stone was a model who was the murder victim in Phoenix Wright's first case.

Name: Frank Sahwit
Description: Frank Sahwit was the sole witness to the murder of Cindy Stone
Tag 1: the first case of defense attorney Phoenix Wright.

Name: Thinker statue
Description: The Thinker clocks are two miniature replicas of the bronze sculpture of the same name by Auguste Rodin. Larry Butz made two of these clocks: one for himself and the other for his then-girlfriend
Tag 1: Cindy Stone.

Name: Miles Edgeworth (beginning)
Description: Miles Edgeworth is a Chief Prosecutor of the prosecutor's office. During his first four years as a prosecutor
Tag 1: he had a perfect win record in trials and was willing to do just about anything to get a guilty verdict for the defendant.

Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Dick Gumshoe is a homicide detective at the police department. He would occasionally help Wright depending on the circumstances behind the case at hand. He also shares a particularly strong bond with Edgeworth and is always trying to help him out
Tag 1: even when it means going behind other prosecutors' backs.

Name: Redd White
Description: Redd White was the chief executive officer of Bluecorp. He used the company to gather scandalous information of various big-name individuals including celebrities
Tag 1: people in finance
Tag 2: and even high-ranking officials in the prosecutor's office.

Name: Maya Fey
Description: Maya Fey is the Master of the Kurain Channeling Technique and
Tag 1: subsequently
Tag 2: the head of the Fey clan. A close friend of defense attorney Phoenix Wright
Tag 3: she was his primary assistant for the majority of his career between the years 2016 and 2019
column7: mainly by participating in his investigations and providing co-counseling duties during trials.

Name: Judge
Description: The unnamed judge has presided over almost all of the cases taken on by the Wright Anything Agency.

Name: Bellboy
Description: An unnamed bellboy who worked at the Gatewater Hotel across from Phoenix Wright's office. He was called to court as a witness in order to testify on a hotel guest's actions at the time of a murder
Tag 1: although he was never asked for his name or occupation at that time.

Name: April May
Description: April May was a secretary at Bluecorp and a witness in the murder of Mia Fey. She accused Mia's sister
Tag 1: Maya
Tag 2: for this crime.

Name: Marvin Grossberg
Description: Marvin Grossberg is a veteran defense attorney who served as Mia Fey's mentor and headed his own law firm
Tag 1: Grossberg Law Offices.

Name: Will Powers
Description: Will Powers is an actor best known for playing the titular role in The Steel Samurai: Warrior of Neo Olde Tokyo. He was the defendant in the murder of co-star Jack Hammer and a witness for the murder of Juan Corrida.

Name: Dee Vasquez
Description: Dee Vasquez was the high-ranking producer of The Steel Samurai: Warrior of Neo Olde Tokyo as well as other shows produced by Global Studios. She had ties to the local mob
Tag 1: which she used from time to time to "erase" people. She was a witness in the murder of actor Jack Hammer.

Name: Penny Nichols
Description: Penny Nichols is a part-time assistant at Global Studios in charge of props. She is obsessed with The Steel Samurai: Warrior of Neo Olde Tokyo
Tag 1: even collecting the show's trading cards.

Name: Wendy Oldbag
Description: Wendy Oldbag is a talkative old woman who has worked as a security guard for various organizations such as Global Studios and KB Security. She was a witness to the separate murders of the two actors Jack Hammer and Juan Corrida.

Name: Jack Hammer
Description: Jack Hammer was a famous action star who played the Evil Magistrate
Tag 1: the main villain on the Global Studios show The Steel Samurai: Warrior of Neo Olde Tokyo. He was the victim in Phoenix Wright's third case.

Name: Sal Manella
Description: Sal Manella is a director at Global Studios best known for directing the TV show The Steel Samurai: Warrior of Neo Olde Tokyo and creating its sequel
Tag 1: The Pink Princess: Warrior of Little Olde Tokyo.

Name: Cody Hackins
Description: Cody Hackins was a fanboy of The Steel Samurai: Warrior of Neo Olde Tokyo and idolized its main character
Tag 1: the Steel Samurai (played by Will Powers).

Name: Steel Samurai
Description: The Steel Samurai is a television hero played by Will Powers
Tag 1: and later in a live stage show by Larry Butz. He was the main character in The Steel Samurai: Warrior of Neo Olde Tokyo
Tag 2: and fought against the Evil Magistrate.

Name: the fence
Description: A fence involved in the deaths of Jack Hammer and an unnamed actor

Name: Mr. Monkey
Description: Mr. Monkey is a fictional character who is the mascot of Global Studios. There is a large statue/clock of him at Global Studios.

Name: Manfred von Karma
Description: Manfred von Karma was a renowned prosecutor who went undefeated for 40 years
Tag 1: earning him numerous "King of Prosecutors" awards
Tag 2: before finally meeting his match in Phoenix Wright. He was Miles Edgeworth's mentor
Tag 3: responsible for teaching him everything about prosecuting until 2016. He was also the father and mentor of Franziska von Karma. For all the cases he took on until Robert Hammond's murder case
column8: and all of the defendants that he prosecuted were convicted.

Name: Robert Hammond
Description: Robert Hammond was a defense attorney who used to work for Marvin Grossberg. He was the victim in Miles Edgeworth's trial.

Name: Yanni Yogi
Description: Yanni Yogi was a bailiff at the District Court
Tag 1: perhaps best known as the prime suspect in the DL-6 Incident. Fifteen years after his trial
Tag 2: he appeared as an apparently senile old witness for the trial of Miles Edgeworth for the murder of his old defense attorney

Name: DL-6
Description: The DL-6 Incident refers to the murder of Gregory Edgeworth that occurred in the elevator of the District Court of Los Angeles in the final days of 2001. The incident directly and indirectly impacted the lives of many people
Tag 1: including but not limited to Manfred von Karma
Tag 2: Miles Edgeworth
column7: and the entire Fey clan. The incident is also what led to Phoenix Wright becoming an attorney
column8: as he only became one after being inspired by Mia Fey (who became an attorney herself following the effects of the incident on the Fey clan).

Name: Lotta Hart
Description: Lotta Hart is a fiery-tempered photographer who appeared as a witness in several of Phoenix Wright's cases
Tag 1: with much of the photographic evidence in said cases coming from her.

Name: Lana Skye
Description: Lana Skye was the defendant in the Bruce Goodman murder case. She was the Chief Prosecutor of Los Angeles at the time
Tag 1: but the case exposed her involvement in forging evidence during the SL-9 Incident.

Name: Ema Skye
Description: Ema Skye is a forensics scientist with the Los Angeles Criminal Affairs Department who was the detective in charge of Apollo Justice's first few cases. As a teenager
Tag 1: nine years before she became a detective
Tag 2: she was Phoenix Wright's investigative partner and co-counsel in the murder of Bruce Goodman and also aided Miles Edgeworth in some of his cases.

Name: Neil Marshall
Description: Neil Marshall was Jake Marshall's younger brother and the final victim in the SL-9 Incident.

Name: Jake Marshall
Description: Jake Marshall was a cowboy-obsessed patrol officer with the Los Angeles Police Department when Bruce Goodman was murdered.

Name: Bruce Goodman
Description: Bruce Goodman was the head detective in the SL-9 Incident. He was killed when he tried to reopen the case two years later.

Name: Angel Starr
Description: Angel Starr is a boxed lunch vendor who was previously a police detective known as the "Cough-Up Queen"
Tag 1: in reference to her ability to get people to "cough-up" information. She was fired after the events of the SL-9 Incident.

Name: Damon Gant
Description: Damon Gant was the eccentric District Chief of Police of the Los Angeles district police department from the conviction of Joe Darke in the SL-9 Incident until the events leading to said case's resolution.

Name: Mike Meekins
Description: Mike Meekins is a clumsy and excitable individual who was an initial suspect in the "murder" of Bruce Goodman in the evidence room of the Los Angeles police department as well as the murder that occurred at the Gatewater Land theme park.

Name: Joe Darke
Description: Joe Darke was a businessman who killed several people in 2015 in an incident known as the SL-9 Incident in police files. He was wrongfully convicted and executed for the murder of Neil Marshall
Tag 1: the only one of the incidents' victims that he did not kill
Tag 2: via falsified evidence.

Name: Miles Edgeworth (post DL-6)
Description: Miles Edgeworth is a Chief Prosecutor of the prosecutor's office. His defeat in court at the hand of his childhood friend Phoenix Wright was the beginning of a series of seismic shifts in his attitude concerning his profession.

Name: SL-9
Description: The SL-9 Incident
Tag 1: colloquially known as the Joe Darke Killings
Tag 2: was a series of murders that culminated in the death of prosecutor Neil Marshall in the Los Angeles Criminal Affairs Department. This led to the trial of Joe Darke
Tag 3: who was found guilty and executed.

Name: Richard Wellington
Description: Richard Wellington
Tag 1: the sole witness of the murder of police officer Dustin Prince
Tag 2: was a self-proclaimed "Drifting Virtuoso" who was looking for the "right" college.

Name: Maggey Byrde
Description: Maggey Byrde was one of Phoenix Wright's clients
Tag 1: who is especially notable for her very bad luck.

Name: Dustin Prince
Description: Dustin Prince was a police officer at the Los Angeles police department who lost his life during a date with fellow police officer Maggey Byrde.

Name: banana glove
Description: The banana glove was the best piece of evidence from any Ace Attorney case.

Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Pearl Fey is a member of a branch family of the Fey clan. She is the daughter of Morgan Fey
Tag 1: who lost her claim to the title of Master to her younger sister Misty. Pearl is a prodigy among spirit mediums
Tag 2: having "intense spiritual power"
Tag 3: and also having knowledge of the Fey clan that exceeds that of Misty's daughter Maya
column7: who is expected to assume the title of Master.

Name: Dr. Grey
Description: Turner Grey was the Grey Surgical Clinic's doctor and director. He was the murder victim in a plot to usurp the position of the Master of Kurain.

Name: Ini Miney
Description: Ini Miney was a college student who was studying parapsychology. She was involved in a fatal car crash in 2016.

Name: Mimi Miney
Description: Mimi Miney was a nurse at the Grey Surgical Clinic working under Turner Grey
Tag 1: until she was involved in a car accident in 2016. She was believed to have died in the incident
Tag 2: with her sister Ini surviving the ordeal. In actuality
column7: under the façade of her sister
column8: was the key witness in the second murder trial of Maya Fey.

Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Morgan Fey was the head of a Fey clan branch family
Tag 1: and the mother of Pearl Fey
Tag 2: Iris
Tag 3: and Dahlia Hawthorne. She has tried twice to put Pearl in the Kurain Master's seat
column7: first by attempting to frame Maya Fey for murder and then by conspiring with Hawthorne to kill her.

Name: Franziska von Karma (start)
Description: Franziska von Karma is a prosecuting attorney and the daughter of the late veteran prosecutor Manfred von Karma. She was the prosecutor for most of Phoenix Wright's cases from June 2017 until March 2018
Tag 1: as well as an acting prosecutor for the trial of Iris of Hazakura Temple.

Name: Maximillian Galactica
Description: Billy Bob Johns
Tag 1: known more commonly by his stage name Maximillion "Max" Galactica
Tag 2: is a stage magician and the most well-known performer at the Berry Big Circus. He was the defendant in the murder of Russell Berry

Name: Ringmaster
Description: Russell Berry was the owner and ringmaster of Berry Big Circus from its opening until his death in 2017. He left behind a daughter
Tag 1: Regina Berry.

Name: Regina Berry
Description: Regina Berry is the naive daughter of the late Berry Big Circus ringmaster Russell Berry. She works as an animal tamer at the circus alongside Regent the tiger and
Tag 1: until his death
Tag 2: Léon the lion.

Name: Larry Curls
Description: Lawrence "Moe" Curls is a circus clown and ringmaster at Berry Big Circus. He took over the ringmaster's position after the murder of the previous ringmaster
Tag 1: Russell Berry.

Name: Trilo Quist
Description: Trilo Quist
Tag 1: a ventriloquist's puppet belonging to Benjamin Woodman
Tag 2: was a piece of evidence in Phoenix Wright's investigation into the murder of Russell Berry.

Name: Benjamin Wood
Description: Benjamin Woodman
Tag 1: usually referred to by his stage name Ben
Tag 2: is a ventriloquist at the Berry Big Circus who testified as a witness to the events leading to the murder of circus ringleader Russell Berry. A shy man
Tag 3: Woodman uses his ventriloquist's dummy Trilo Quist
column7: which he has given a completely opposite personality

Name: Acro
Description: Ken "Acro" Dingling was an acrobat whose legs were paralyzed during an accident six months prior to the murder of Russell Berry and the trial of Max Galactica
